snippet: Brendan Emmett Quigley's puzzle highlights an Irish author and rebel.
abstract: Brendan Emmett Quigley's puzzle highlights an Irish author and rebel.
lead_paragraph: WEDNESDAY'S PUZZLE - Brendan BEHAN was a lot of things: most chiefly among them, he was a poet and a novelist, a volunteer with the Irish Republican Army and, by his own admission, a drunk. The first two made him famous, the last killed him. What came in between sent him to prison, but it richly informed his writing. It's difficult to encapsulate a writer like Mr. Behan in one small paragraph, but I'd like to move on to Brendan Emmett Quigley's puzzle.
